main event: A bright, creamy white object was observed for 55 seconds by 8 witnesses in Klamath, California on 20 November 1962.
interesting points: The object was compared to background stars and was much brighter than them., It had a rotating beacon-like light and moved in an erratic manner., Witnesses thought the object was a star until its movement was noticed., The sighting was characterized by conflicting witness statements and no physical trace evidence., The object was considered unidentified but was noted to possibly be a balloon or aircraft due to its flight characteristics.
sighted object: creamy white object with a rotating light
